msbt.message: Seeing fossils in person is such a different experience from reading about them in guide books!
They say this room alone shares hundreds of millions of years' worth of natural history. That's humbling

Just imagine all these creatures swimming in ancient oceansI feel like underwater life is a mystery now, but the things in here are from a world we can barely imagine!Sorry, these ideas just blow my mind.
I wonder what colors they were. Their fossils don't tell us that.Pink, maybe? No, probably not
How much do you think things like this could put away? Hmm I'm glad I didn't ever have to host them for a dinner party.
You can tell from their bones that some of these creatures were huge, terrifying monsters! I'd probably scream myself hoarse if I ever ran into one somehow
All of the fossilized creatures here are long gone from our worldIt makes me sad that we'll never be able to meet any of them.
Fossils are the only evidence we have left that some of these creatures ever existed at all. I guess we're lucky that they left something behind to let us know they were here before we were.
Imagine ending up fossilized and on display for museum-goersSeems unlikely when you read up on how rare fossils are, but that doesn't mean it's impossible!
I want to bake some fossil-shaped cookies, so I'm here for research.
, I'm curious Do you have a favorite fossil here?
I keep coming back to this exhibit. There are some really unique and unusual fossils on display here.
I rushed right over as soon as heard the museum was open, .Isn't the fossil collection amazing?
I just love the atmosphere of this room, !I guess that's why I haven't seen any other exhibits yet, .
I'm so glad we finally have a museum that's worthy of !I heard it's open around the clock, in case you need to see fossils in the middle of the night,
